St. Francis Junior has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Francis Junior will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Edward ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Clever's Origin Kindergarten

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Johnson. He is the Deputy Head teacher at Clever’s Origin Kindergarten School a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Mutungo, Kampala District with 200 students. Clever’s Origin Kindergarten School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultrafiltration water system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra filtration water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Clever’s Origin Kindergarten will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Johnson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Clever's Origin Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Johnson. He is the Deputy Head teacher at Clever’s Origin Junior School a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Mutungo, Kampala District with 800 students. Clever’s Origin Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultrafiltration water system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an Ultra filtration water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Clever’s Origin Junior will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Johnson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose de 61 años de edad posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Don Jose está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y así el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 61 years old and has a tailoring shop in his home where he produces different types of clothing. As of late, he has gained many customers because he does excellent work and charges really affordable prices. Jose is a man who is extremely devoted to his work, in addition to being responsible and honest. He and his family live in their own home.

Don Jose is requesting a loan so that he can buy fabrics, thread, needles, and everything else that he needs to sew. This will allow him to continue satisfying the needs of his customers and also have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Seepalatafale

texts.en:
Seepalatafale is a 27-year-old unmarried woman with 5 children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience with this business. 

Seepalatafale needs a loan to buy new grills, boxes of boneless chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soya sauce, paper plates, and large pots. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Seepalatafale has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy new grills, boxes of boneless chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soya sauce, paper plates, and large pots.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is 46 years old and married with 7 children. She has owned and operated a small store to sell a variety of items for 3 years. 

Peka needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, soft drinks, plastic bags, and a new display refrigerator. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and her family's weekly expenses. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, soft drinks, plastic bags, and a new display refrigerator.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth es una mujer muy joven, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación. Tiene 29 años, es casada, y madre de 2 niños pequeños. Hace poco más de tres años desarrollo el negocio de comercio, con la idea de apoyar a su esposo económicamente, ser independiente, y principalmente apoyar con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos. Ella hace una buena administración de su negocio, y ha desarrollado buenas técnicas de venta, el negocio tiene la capacidad de hacerle frente al préstamo y poder pagar las mensualidades, ya que la inyección de capital de trabajo le va a permitir aumentar sus ventas. 
El préstamo se va a invertir en la compra de mercadería, ya que pretende prepararse para la temporada alta que se avecina. Esto le permitirá fortalecer su negocio.
La forma de comercializar sus productos es de forma ambulante, en su comunidad y otras aledañas. Vende ropa interior, bolsos, lociones y cremas, pero su fuerte son los utensilios de cocina como recipientes plásticos de marca Tupperware, de muy buena calidad. Tiene mucha facilidad para vender, y buen trato a sus clientes. Solicita el primer crédito a Fundación Mujer.
texts.en:
Lizeth is an enterprising young woman, who dreams of getting ahead. She is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two small children. A little less than three years ago, she developed a trading business, with the hopes of supporting her husband economically, being independent, and mostly of helping with the costs of her children's education. 

She runs her business well, and has developed good selling techniques. The business has the ability to cope with the loan and to be able to pay the monthly payments, since the investment of capital into business will allow her to improve her sales. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, since she is working on preparing herself for the upcoming busy season. This will allow her to strengthen her business. 

She advertises her products by making rounds in her community and other surrounding communities. She sells undergarments, purses, lotions, and creams, but her strength is in selling kitchen wares such as Tupperware containers of high quality. She has a lot of skill in selling, and treats her customers well. This is her first loan from Fundación Mujer.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, purses, lotions, creams, and kitchen wares like plastic containers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries, soft drinks and other items for stocking her store.

loans.name: Manjola

texts.en:
Manjola is a 33-year-old married woman with children who are 16, 10 and 5 years old. Their family lives in the district of Korca, in the southeastern part of the country. 

Manjola and her husband run an agriculture business and also buy and sell fresh produce and have an ice cream van. They plant, harvest, and sell large quantities of corn, wheat, and broom straw.  They buy apples, potatoes, and onions and sell them in the capital city. Manjola's husband takes the ice cream van to schools around the villages.

Manjola wants to buy fresh produce to sell and the loan will help her achieve the goal.

loans.use: to buy  fresh produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cement, bricks and sand to build a house.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 34 years old, married and the mother of one child, who is in school. She works very hard to support her family. 

For the past seven years, Roselyn has been runing a general store in the Philippines and is now requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Merry Ann

texts.en:
Merry Ann is 35 years old and married, with four children. Two of her children are in school. Merry Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Merry Ann runs a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,500 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of coconut wine to sell.

Merry Ann has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Merry Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Alejandrina  tiene 50 años de edad es casada  y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de ropa y venta de productos de belleza  como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para hombres.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "QORICHASKAS" which is located in the province of Cusco.

Alejandrina is 50 years old, married and has three children. She combines her daily activities with her business of selling clothing and the sale of beauty products like creams, perfume, cologne amongst others. She has been involved in this business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She is a responsible and persevering person and this is the way she gets her family ahead.

Alejandrina is requesting the loan to buy cologne for men. She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to buy cologne for men.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Juana  tiene 46 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de productos de limpieza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, a la vez la socia se dedica a rentar habitaciones en su casa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para remodelar  uno de sus cuartos. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Qorichaskas."  The members of this group live in Cusco province.  

Juana is 46 years old, and lives with her partner and her 2 children.  She alternates her time between her daily activities and her business selling cleaning products.  She's had this business for quite a long time, and it is doing very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day.  In addition to this, she also rents rooms in her home.  She wants to be able to continue to work and support her family.

Juana is requesting a loan to remodel one of her rooms.  She feels grateful to be receiving this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to remodel one of her rental rooms

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard -working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 56 years old and has five children who are in school.

Luzviminda has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan on November 8, 2013. Luzviminda requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to  buy additional stocks of fruit to sell to restart her business activities.

Luzviminda has been in this business for three years and would like to rebuild it with your help.  In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of fruit to sell

loans.name: Motacu Group

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, madre de tres niños de 12, 7, y 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de refrigerios.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, luchadora, constante y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad, un sitio popular caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Veronica es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, complexión robusta, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (abajo al medio, blusa negra, pantalón gris). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y sus tres hijos que asisten a la escuela. Debido a la necesidad de generar mejores ingresos económicos para pagar los gastos de sus tres hijos, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerios, ella se dedica a preparar sándwiches de miga con mortadela, tomate y un toque de mayonesa para merienda, los empaqueta y como; a media mañana o a media tarde los vende de forma ambulante en el recreo de las escuelas y a media mañana a los empleados de las tiendas. Ella sueña con tener su snack y ya no tener que caminar largas distancias a entregar sus pedidos. Su deseo es aumentar su capital de trabajo preparando más meriendas debido a que tiene pedidos y su clientela aumentó.
Es por esos motivos que Veronica solicita un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes de merienda por mayor para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica, 30, is a married mother of 3 children aged 12, 7, and 3 years. Her business is making and selling lunches.

She is a good mother, responsible, a fighter, stable, and hard-working. She works in the southern part of the city, a popular and commercial area.

Veronica has olive skin, is of medium build, has long black hair, a robust complexion and her mother tongue is Spanish and guaraní from her parents (middle centre, black shirt, grey pants). She shares her life with her husband, who works, and her three children, who are in school. Due to the need to generate more income to pay the expenses of having three children, she formed a communal bank with others who have different businesses, but similar needs in order to request a loan to improve her own business.

Her business is making and selling lunches. She dedicates her time making cheese (mortadella) and tomato sandwiches with just a touch of mayonnaise. She wraps them up and around mid morning, she sells them as an ambulant salesperson to schools during recess and at noon to store employees. She dreams of owning her own snack shop, so she doesn't have to go long distances to deliver her orders. Her desire is to increase her business capital by having more prepared lunches for sale.

This is why Veronica is requesting a loan to invest in wholesale ingredients to make lunches and expand her business.

loans.use: buy wholesale ingredients to make lunches in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for used clothes

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Her name is Lucresia, 55, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynato, her business partner, and has two children. She manages their household while operating a business. They work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. Lucresia owns and oversees operation of her jeepney service.

She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) of jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, the jeepneys are constantly packed with passengers. Jeepneys offer one of the cheapest ways of getting somewhere. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the second World War and are still to be seen throughout the Philippines, in many colors and all over the place. 

Originally, jeepneys were old American jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army who occupied the Philippines for several years. After the Japanese army was defeated and the American military mission was completed, the jeeps were left by the tens of thousands on the islands in the Philippines.The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats in them, one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. Jeepney transport service is one of the stable businesses in the Philippines.

To help her continue operations of her business, Lucresia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use for repairs and maintenance of her jeepney. It is very important that her unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. Her husband drives it, so she is assured that her jeepney is well taken care of. Her earnings from their service is their means of living.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Lucresia hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful. She dreams for her children to get the best education. She prays for the safety of her husband in driving and for a better future for all of them. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Her name is Emily, 42, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She has a child who is in High School. Although she is separated, she has her own business. The income from her store helps meet their personal and household needs and the school needs of her child.  

Emily operates a general variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 300 a day. 

To help her expand operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, soda and also add some clothes to her store. She is positive that her sales will increase as she expands her business. Her income from the store is her means of support and meets their daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Emily aims to grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her child the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more grocery items and add clothes to her store.

loans.name: Dúo Donai Group

texts.es:
DUO DONAI
Este dúo está formado por las señora Leona, de 44 años de edad, ella es de Santiago Sacatepéquez del municipio  de Sacatepéquez., doña Leona es líder de este grupo  y se dedica a la venta de refacciones, atoles, chuchitos, dobladas etc., y su negocio se ubica en la Zona 3 Santiago, ella desea crecer  sus ganancias ya que la demanda de sus servicios han aumentado, ella desea invertir en productos que le sirven para cocinar y quiere comprar ollas mas grandes ya que las que utiliza actualmente son muy pequeñas,  y quiere comprar mesas y sillas ya que sus clientes han aumentado.
texts.en:
Donai Group

This group was started by Sra. Leona. She is 44 years old and from Santiago Sacatepéquez in the town of Sacatepéquez. Doña Leona is the leader of this group and sells snacks, “atole” (a beverage made from corn), Guatemalan tamales, turnovers, and other items. Her business is located in District 3 Santiago. She wants to grow her earnings since the demand for her services has increased.

Leona wants to invest in products for cooking, as well as larger pots since the ones that she is currently using are quite small. In addition, she will buy tables and chairs since the number of customers has increased.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking, larger pots, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Evangelina  tiene 54 años de edad es conviviente  y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de ropa como chompas, casacas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas, pantalones entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the QORICHASKAS communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco.

Evangelina, 54, has a partner and two children. Her daily activities include running her clothing business, selling sweaters and jackets, among other items. This associate has spent a long time dedicating herself to her business, which is going very well, thanks to her dedication every day. By being responsible and hard-working, she's moving forward with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy sweaters and jackets, among other items.

The associate is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: buy sweaters, jackets and other items.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a hardworking mother of two and a very supportive partner to her husband Erwin. She is from Carmona, Cavite, Philippines, and she is one of the Factory Workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Eufemia works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor.  She directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators. 

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Eufemia is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Eufemia is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward for your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay their house rental.

Eufemia only dreams to have sufficiency in their daily needs particularly in the education of her children. She wants them to have a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for their house rental.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un joven emprendedor, soltero, trabaja brindando servicio de atención al cliente en un grifo de su ciudad natal, Nazca. Por falta de recursos económicos en su hogar aún no puede estudiar una carrera profesional, por eso con el dinero que gana cubre los gastos de su hogar y ahorra para poder matricularse y estudiar una profesión. Su familia es el motor de su vida por eso está luchando arduamente para sacarlos adelante.
Marco está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer mejoras en su casa como reforzar las paredes y pintarrajear, así su familia estará más asegura y cómoda y el no tendrá ninguna preocupación y seguirá laborando con normalidad para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco is a resourceful young man. He is single and works providing customer service in a gas station in his hometown, Nazca. Because of the lack of financial resources in his household, he has not yet earned a professional degree, so with the money that he earns, he covers his household expenses and saves to be able to enroll and study a profession. His family is the driving force in his life, so he is striving arduously to provide for them. 

Marco is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided, he will be able to make improvements to his house, like reinforcing the walls and plastering. This way, his family will be more secure and comfortable; he will not have any worries and will continue working as usual to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to plaster and reinforce the walls of his house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused, God-fearing, and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells stationery. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are the general public. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be delay in payment. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of stationery. Her business goal is to have her own company of stationery supplies within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions. This is her fourth  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stationery

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is a factory worker, age 34. He lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines with his wife and two children. He has been in the service for two years through the aid of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Marlon works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor.  He directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators. 

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Marlon, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Marlon is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to any loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. He looks forward to your positive response, and any help from you will surely be of great help. He will use the loan to redeem the ATM card that he pawned, and also to pay other debt and expenses, especially the education of his children.

Marlon wants to be successful someday. He desires to become a General Manager or a Pastor. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To redeem his pawned ATM card and pay for their other expenses.

loans.name: Frankis

texts.es: Frankis de 42 años de edad se dedica a la fabricacion de bateas, recipiente de cemento que sirve para el lavado manual de ropa, a las familias. Esté negocio se derivó de su experiencia de trabajo en el fronterizo pais de venezuela, cuando trabajó en una fabrica importante. Los principales clientes de Frankis son las ferreterías del barrio y propietarios de diversos negocios vecinos; Frankis compra a mayoristas de cemento quienes le ofrecen precios competitivos, con los cuales él puede dar a su clientela unos precios ajustados a su posibilidad de pagar . Sus ventas las realiza a credito y de contado, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local y contar con toda la infraestructura requerída, para tener una gran empresa y continuar mejorando sus ingresos lo cual es su mayor desafio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arena, cemento, pintura etc. Con esta inversión aumentará su productividad y disminuirá los costos de venta, para dar cumplimiento a su politica de buenos precios y cumplir efectivamente con su clientela, lo que hace de este credikiva una inversión que favorece el mejoramiento de este negocio.
texts.en:
Frankis, 42, has a business making cement trays that are used for washing clothes by hand.  He learned this business when he was working in an important factory located in the bordering country of Venezuela.  Frankis' main customers are the hardware stores in the area, and also the owners of a variety of different businesses in the neighborhood.  

Frankis buys his cement from the wholesalers who offer competitive prices.  This way, he can give his customers prices that they can afford.  He makes his sales on a cash and credit basis, and he works from 7am until 4pm.  His long-term goal is to have his own shop where he has the entire infrastructure needed to have a great company.  This way, he could continue to increase his income, which is his main challenge.  

At this time, Frankis is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has done through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, he will purchase sand, cement, paint, etc.  This investment will increase his productivity and reduce his costs of production so that he can continue with his policy of selling at good prices, satisfying his customers and making this Kiva loan a good investment for his business.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, paint, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu.  She is married. In 1994, Isatu established her slippers (ladies, gents and children) business. She began her business because she wants to give support to her husband and to meet other family demands. Her business is located in the city centre and her customers are of all ages. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy additional slippers. She hopes that this loan will bring about a continuous increase in her business revenue. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for slippers (ladies, gents and children).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase brick floor tiles, cement, sand and gravel for installing brick flooring in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Jose de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza de ganado, adicional a eso también se dedica a l cultivo de maíz y yuca, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganado y concentrado para poder continuar con la crianza y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old and has been raising cattle for 15 years. In addition, he grows corn and cassava. His products are sold at different markets. With what he earns from his sales, Jose has been able to get ahead. He and his family live in their own home.

Jose is requesting a loan so that he can buy more cattle and concentrated feed. This will allow him to continue raising these animals so that he and his family can have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cattle and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a married woman. She describes herself as creative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a competitive location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be able to yield high returns within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will own land. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Cathreen

texts.en:
Cathreen is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as focused and God fearing. 

Cathreen operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy residential area, and her primary customers are individuals. She says that her biggest business challenge is water shortage.

Cathreen will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy water tanks for business use and to start an M-pesa business. Her business goal is to have a chain of businesses within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a successful person.

This is Cathreen's tenth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to invest back in the business.

loans.use: to buy water tanks and start an M-pesa business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Sonia  tiene 45 años de edad es separada y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta medias, la socia vende por el centro de la ciudad su mercadería a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de medias para mujeres.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank QORICHASKAS, which is located in the province of Cusco. She is 45 years old, separated and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling socks. She sells her merchandise in the downtown area of the city to all of her customers. Sonia has been running this business for a long time, and it's going well thanks to her determination every day. 

Sonia would like to keep working in order to keep supporting her family. She's asking for a loan to  buy women's socks. She's grateful for the loan that's she's being given and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy women's socks.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be a risktaker. He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors and windows. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a competitive location and his primary customers are the general public. 

Samuel describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of welding materials. His business goal is to have a bigger stall within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved profits and living standards. This is his second  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of welding materials

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta wants to have a stall or boutique to display her products. She also desires to help her relatives who are in need. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be excellent. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. 

Beth's primary customers are wholesalers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a profitable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her tenth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Frediswinda

texts.en:
Her name is Frediswinda, 58, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Federico who works in a hardware store. They have five children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send four children to school. 

Frediswinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  She also sells mineral water by the gallons. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 

To help her continue and expand operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, mineral water, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other groceries. She is positive that her sales will increase as she expands her business. Her earnings are their way to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Frediswinda hopes to maintain and grow her business so her children can have the best education possible. She prays for the good health and happiness of her family.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Her name is Nora. She is 55 and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Nora is married to Levi, a driver, and they have four children. One is in college, two are in high school, and one is in elementary school. Nora manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her four children to school. 

Nora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a living by buying at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this general store, she also has a billiard business. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 400 a day. 

To help her continue operating her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda, and other grocery merchandise. She is positive that her sales will increase as she expands her business. Her earnings enable her to meet her daily expenses and send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Nora hopes to maintain and grow her business so that she and her family can have a better life. She strives very hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week in a setting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in materials to cement the floor in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more poultry stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Daisy Marilys

texts.es: Daisy, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 12 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa camisas, blusas, jeans, short, etc. y a la confección de ropa como vestidos, blusas, pantalones y otros trajes que soliciten. La ropa la vende de forma ambulante y por pedidos. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo, el cual es por 7,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas mercadería como pantalones, camisas, blusas y calcetas. La inversión le ayudara a surtir mas el negocio y asi poder satisfacer a los clientes. Su meta es mantenerse siempre con el negocio de venta de ropa y confección para poderle dar estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Daisy is 35 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives in the township of Morazán, Yoro. For 12 years she has been selling clothing such as shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, etc., and making clothing such as dresses, blouses, pants, and other items that customers ask for. She sells the clothing as a street vendor and on order. She is applying for a second loan, which is for 7000 lempiras, and she is going to invest it in the purchase of more merchandise such as pants, shirts, blouses and socks. The investment will help her stock her business more and thus she will be able to satisfy her customers. Her goal is to continue with her business of selling and making clothing in order to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, and socks to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es: Sandra de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 8 años y una de 4 meses de edad. Ella siempre ha puesto todo de su parte para darle lo mejor a sus hijas apoyada en su compañero de vida que se gana la vida como pescador y en su negocio de venta de verduras el que realiza de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos. La familia de Sandra vive en una casa pequeña por lo que ella desea ampliar un cuarto de esta y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, cuartones y tejas para ampliar un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Sandra is 28 years old. She lives in her own house along with her life companion and their two daughters, ages 8 and 4 months. She has always made every effort to give the best to her daughters, supported by her life companion, who earns a living as a fisherman, and by her business of selling vegetables, which she does as a street vendor in the nearby areas. Sandra's family lives in a little house, and so she wants to expand one of its rooms. For this, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, beams, and tiles to expand a room in her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, beams, and tiles to expand a room in her house.

loans.name: Gislen

texts.es:
La señora Gislen  de 32 años de edad  vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de Amapala en el sur de Honduras y se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 3 años, sus clientes son los amigos y personas cercanas a su comunidad.
Doña Gislen es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de curiles, robalos, etc. ya que desea con el préstamo  comprar más productos y así obtener más ganancias y así salir adelante en su negoció y con su  familia. 

San Lorenzo - Honduras de Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Gislen is 32 years old and lives with her husband. They have two children who depend on her. She lives in a community in Amapala in Southern Honduras, and she has worked selling fish for 3 years. Her customers are her friends and neighbours in her community.

Doña Gislen is an enterprising woman with the desire to move forward. She is asking for this loan to buy "curiles" (a type of cockle shell mollusc), sea bass etc. She wants to buy more products with the loan and so increase her income and move forward in her business and with her family.

San Lorenzo - Honduras, September 2014.

loans.use: to buy curiles, sea bass etc. for her business.

loans.name: G.s La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El Joven Willian es un hombre emprendedor y dedicado a su negocio propio que es la venta de aceites para vehículos y motocicletas actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación vende aceites, liquido de frenos y también se dedica a la venta de llantas para vehículos.
Willian también realiza reparaciones de frenos de vehículos y cambio de disco de closh, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de aceites, llantas, liquido de frenos, bujías, etc. para poderles seguir brindado sus servicios a los clientes y a su vez que le permita salir adelante junto con su familia.
Willian sueña poder atraves de las ganancias ampliar su negocio.
Don José se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 15 años.
Doña Faustina se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 1 año. 


Danlí,  Honduras - Agosto 2014
texts.en:
Wilian is an enterprising young man who is dedicated to his business. He has been selling oil for vehicles and motorcycles for two years. His business is located in his home. He sells oil, brake liquid, and also tires for vehicles.

Wilian also repairs brakes and changes clutch discs. He is applying for a loan to buy oil, tires, brake liquid, spark plugs, etc. to continue offering his services to clients, as well as to move forward along with his family.

Wilian dreams of expanding his business with his earnings. 

José has been selling clothing and shoes for 15 years. Faustina has been selling clothing and cosmetics for one year.

Danlí,  Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy oil, tires, brake liquid, spark plugs, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a Kiva borrower. He has 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

Erick has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive location, and his primary customers are the general public. He says that his biggest business challenge is financial constraints.

Erick will use the KES 40,000 loan to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a quality life and earn more profits.

This is Erick's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables.

Joshua's business is located in a rural area, and his primary customers are the general public. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy pesticides, fertilizer and seedlings.

Joshua's business goal is to have other businesses within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have improved his lifestyle.

This is Joshua's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy pesticides, fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be focused and God fearing. 

Rosalie operates a poultry farm where she sells chicken and eggs. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inadequate capital and the outbreak of poultry diseases. 

Rosalie will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of poultry. Her business goal is to have a well stocked poultry farm within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of poultry

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a married woman. She has four children ranging in age from 19 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

Jecinta operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers buy daily. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Jecinta will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of groceries. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a married man. He has three children aged two years and ten years. He describes himself to be self-motivated. 

Silas operates as a carpenter making furniture. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a developing area and his primary customers are daily. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Silas will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more carpentry materials. His business goal is to have an exhibition room to display his products within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement blocks, iron, cement, gravel, sand, and metal sheeting to finish building the kitchen and the bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio Hernan pertenece al banco comunal BUENA ESPERANZA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio  tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una agencia de viajes, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos.
El socio  se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Hernan is part of the communal bank BUENA ESPERANZA.  The bank is located in the district and department of Cusco.

He is 33 years old and single.  He alternates between his daily tasks and working in a travel agency.  He does well in his business thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day.  He wishes to be able to continue working and in this way get ahead.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of tickets for tourism sites.  He is grateful for the loan he is granted and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tickets for tourism sites.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as determined.

Grace operates a retail business where she sells milk. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are the general public. She says that her biggest business challenge is lack of capital.

Grace will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more milk to sell. Her business goal is to have a chain of businesses within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, iron and bricks to build a room in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es:
La señora Glenda de 36  años de edad vive con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella, vive una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de pescados desde hace 10 años.
Doña Glenda su venta es con los amigos y personas que se dedica a comercializar con este producto para el Salvador. Es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Glenda está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pescado, curiles, etc.  ya que desea el préstamo  para invertir más en su negocio y así obtener más ganancias y hacerlo crecer más y  sacar adelante a su familia.
Su sueño es tener su propio negocio y que sus hijos tengas más oportunidades.  


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Glenda is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three dependent children. She lives in a community in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has worked selling fish for 10 years. Glenda sells to friends and people who commercialize the product in El Salvador. She is an entrepreneurial woman with a desire to get ahead. 

Glenda is asking for a loan to buy fish, shellfish, etc. She would like to use the loan to invest in her business and with this, to be able to earn more and make it grow in order to help her family get ahead. Her dreams are to have her own business and for her children to have more opportunities.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be focused. 

Melisa operates a dairy farm where she keeps cows, which produce milk for sale. Her business is located in a semi-urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

Melisa will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and medicine. Her business goal is to be a milk supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and medicine

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as being determined. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient capital. 

Jane will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. 

This is Jane's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of medicine.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells drinks and other items. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

He will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks and other items. His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future he will economically empower himself. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to invest back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, corrugated metal sheets and wire in order to cement the floor and install rain gutters on the roof of her home.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
This is Estella. She is 50 years old and resides with her family in Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she profits well from this. She also operates a jeepney for her additional income. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Estella would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Estella hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be slow seasons. 

Samuel will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to expand the business, and open another branch within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will open other branches. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will plow back the anticipated profits to the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman; she has four children. She describes herself to be focused and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather, which affects business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Filomon

texts.es:
El señor Filomon de 56  años de edad es soltero  y tiene casa propia no tiene  hijos que dependen de él,  vive en la comunidad de puerto grande Amapala y se dedica a la venta de pescados actividad desde hace 30 años.
Don Filomon sale todos los días a vender pescado es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante.
Don Filomon está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  pescado, curiles, etc. ya que desea vender más para tener mejores ganancias y así mejorar más sus ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señor Filomon is 56 years old and single. He has his own house and does not have any children that depend on him. He lives in a big port town called Amapala and he has made a living selling fish for 30 years. 

Señor Filomon goes out every day to sell fish. He is a hard-working man with a desire to get ahead. He is asking for a loan in order to buy fish, clams, etc. as he wishes to sell more in order to make more profit. In this way he hopes to improve his income so that he can continue to support his family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to buy fish, clams, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora  de 61 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su familia,  no tiene casa propia, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras. Se dedica a la actividad de venta de pescado desde hace 6 años.
Doña Dora su venta es en el mercado de San Lorenzo también vende  de manera ambulante está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de pescado blanco y rojo con el préstamo desea  que su negocio crezca y obtenga más ganancias y poder seguir trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Uno de sus sueños es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Dora is 61 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her family in a house that is not her own. 

She lives in San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras and has worked selling fish for the last 6 years. Dora sells her fish in the San Lorenzo market and also in the street. She is asking for a loan to buy white and red fish to expand her business and earn more income. 

Dora wants to continue working to improve her quality of life and that of her family. One of her dreams is to improve her house.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to buy white and red fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Urpi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yony ella es casada y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende quinua, maíz y trigo, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de fotocopiadora.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Urpi Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member, Yony, is 46 years old and married, and has four children.  She works in her business selling grains.  She sells quinoa, corn, and wheat, working from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.  She has five years of experience in this business and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her business selling grains.

Yony's requesting the loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The member who is attached to the group photo had permission to have her picture taken after the meeting for work reasons.  The other members work in a restaurant, sell clothing, sell groceries, and make photocopies.

Yony's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this means and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him, as he was able to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their videoke (video/karaoke) machine and video games. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for him to pay for the maintenance of their videoke machine and apartment. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Jeremias hopes to sustain the growing needs of his family. He also desires to give the best education to his children. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain his videoke machine and apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused . She operates a retail business where she sells garments. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Rose will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of garments. Her business goal is to open a shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of garments

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Angeles, a driver, and she has children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rita hopes to sustain their everyday needs. She plans to have her house renovated, and she wants to expand her store soon. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel owns and operates a jeepney unit. He has been successful in this business for years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.
 
Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. He is requesting an amount of PHP 8,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in his business.

Ruel is hoping that he could buy another unit of jeepney so he could increase his profit from his business. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is an organic farmer certified. He is a cacao farmer in the Maya Mountain  who lives in the beautiful village of Indian Creek in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He explains the benefits of selling cacao, and the income earned helps him with the daily expense for home and for school uses. 

Pablo sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. He believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop, that is both good for the environment, and will help develop his local community. 

He wants to secure a KIVA micro-loan so that he might expand his cacao farm by purchasing grafted, high-yielding, disease resistant cacao seedlings. He plans to use the revenue generated from his cacao crop to educate his children and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to prune and transplant cacao trees.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
Doña Emilce es la tesorera del Solidaria Mujer Mujeres en Acción, ella es una clienta con mucha trayectoria en Fundación Mujer y su grupo está compuesto por 4 socias, incluyéndola. Todas van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias. 
Ella es una mujer que se dedica a actividades agropecuarias hace mucho tiempo. Tiene 52 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos, con ella vive solo una de sus hijas menores, y su esposo. Doña Emilce se dedica a la cría y desarrollo de ganado, en algunas ocasiones cría otro tipo de animales, y siembra algunos cultivos. Ella ya ha solicitado varios préstamos a Fundación Mujer, y gracias a eso pudo consolidar y fortalecer su negocio. Además de este gran logro, lo más importante para ella es que a través de los años y gracias a esta actividad productiva ella ha podido pagar los estudios de sus hijas las menores que actualmente están en la universidad. Ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo son para solventar los gastos de alimentación y otros básicos. Esta mujer tan entregada y trabajadora sigue luchando por su familia y por darles a sus hijos la mejor herencia como ella dice "el estudio".
