Está nueva inversión será para la compra de activo semoviente como los terneros e insumos necesarios para su desarrollo. Esto le permite mantener el nivel de producción de sus animales, así como sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Emilce is the treasurer of Solidaria Mujer Mujeres en Acción. She is a very experienced client with Fundación Mujer. Her group is made up of four members, including her. All of them are going to invest in agricultural activities. Emilce has worked in agriculture for a long time. She's 52 years old and married with four children. She only lives with one of her youngest daughters and her husband. 

Emilce raises livestock. On occasion she has raised other animals and also plants crops. She has asked for several loans from Fundación Mujer, and thanks to this she has been able to strengthen her business. On top of this great success, the most important thing for her is that through the years she's been able to pay for her daughters' schooling thanks to her productive business, and since her husband's income pays for food and other basic expenses. Her two youngest daughters are currently attending university. This dedicated, hardworking woman keeps fighting to give her children the best inheritance, which, as she says, is going to school. 

This new investment will be used to buy livestock such as calves, and the necessary products for their development. This will allow her to maintain the level of animal production and her income as well.

loans.use: to buy livestock such as calves and the necessary products for their development.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables and other crops. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy market area,  and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of rain and increased pest attacks. 

Elizabeth will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of the vegetables within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be self reliant.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self sustained and develop her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build her house of durable materials because it is currently made of wood.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be self sustained. She will use the anticipated profits to put up another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Sheena May

texts.en:
Sheena May works hard to support her family. Sheena May is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Sheena May has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Sheena May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es:
Fredy es un humilde porcicultor de 52 años de edad que ha dedicado 10 años de su vida a realizar esta actividad y gracias a ella pudo vivir dignamente junto con su esposa y tres hijos, cabe aclarar que Fredy es la única entrada económica de la familia, Fredy se encarga de comercializar sus cerdos. 
Fredy quiere aprovechar la temporada de diciembre que se está avecinando  y desea solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos los cuales esperar engordar y sacar buen provecho de su venta con el objetivo de llevar en el mes de diciembre regalos a sus hijos que con tantas ansias esperan esta fecha.
texts.en:
Fredy is a humble 52-year-old pig farmer. He has done this for ten years and, thanks to this, he's been able to live with dignity together with his wife and three kids. Fredy's is the only source of income for the family. He is in charge of selling his pigs. 

He would like to take advantage because the December season is looming. He'd like to ask for a loan to buy pigs to fatten up in order to make a lot of money from his sales. His objective is to get gifts for his children in December, as they are waiting anxiously for that season.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and fatten up in order to sell them in December, which is the high season

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 58 years old and a widow with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Raquel has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Raquel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and cows.

loans.name: Ehiby

texts.es:
La señora Ehiby de 35  años de edad, vive con su mama y su hijo  se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de refrescos de todo tipo y tamaños, jugos, malteadas, agua en bolsa, paletas de leche, choco bananos, etc.
Doña Ehiby vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como refrescos, bolsas con agua, bananos, chocolate, jugos, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Ehiby is 35 years old and lives with her mom and her son. She has worked for five years in her business selling soft drinks of different kinds and sizes, juice, milkshakes, water bags, palettes of milk, chocolate bananas, etc. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman who would like to get ahead. She fights every day to improve her quality of life. 

She asking for a loan to buy products such as soft drinks, water bags, bananas, chocolate, juice, etc. With the support of the loan, she hopes to improve her income and her quality of life as well. Her dreams are to have a good, well-stocked business, and at the same time to improve her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  - September 2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water bags, bananas, chocolate, juice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Engracia Antonia

texts.es:
La Joven Engracia Antonia de 25  años de edad, vive con su hermana se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de mercadería como vestidos de niña, gorros, cobertores de licuadora, cobertores de sanitarios, piñatas, y también hace trabajos de sastre o costura, etc. vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Engracia Antonia también elabora piñatas y realiza manualidades, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de hilo de lana, ganchos simples, silicón en barra, papel periódico, alambre de amarre, pegamento, etc. Con  el préstamo pretende tener más producto para la venta y mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Engracia Antonia is a 25-year-old young woman.  She lives with her sister.  For five years she has worked at a business selling girls’ dresses, hats, blender covers, toilet covers, piñatas, and also doing tailoring jobs.  She lives in the city of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.  She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead.  She fights day after day to improve her quality of life.

Engracia Antonia also makes piñatas and crafts.  She is asking for this loan to buy yarn, hooks, hot glue sticks, newsprint, wire filament, glue, etc.   With the loan she plans to have more products to sell and improve her income and her quality of life.

Her dream is to have a good, well-stocked business and, at the same time, to improve her future, together with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy yarn, hooks, hot glue sticks, newsprint, wire filament, glue, etc., for her business

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa, or Hope in English, requests this loan to buy a freezer for an agricultural tractor that her husband has been operating for sometime. The amount is ALL 200,000 (Albanian lek). 

Shpresa is 51 and a married mother. She does agriculture for a living. Wheat and onions are what her focus has mostly been on. She plants and sells these in large quantities. She also plants broom straws and sells handmade brooms, called ‘fshesa’ in Albanian. The price for such a broom is about USD 1.20. Shpresa has been photographed with such straws. 

Shpresa and her family live in the southeastern part of the country, in the district of Korca, known for being the pioneer in the beer production, first Albanian school, serenades, and the cobblestone streets. The large quantities of produce, including apples, beans, rye, oats, beans, corn, potatoes, cherries, and chestnuts are tied to its name, as well.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for the agricultural tractor her husband runs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy provisions.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina  de 43 años de edad, habita en un municipio a orillas del mar, donde se dedica a la venta de calzado, perfumería, ropa y además prepara productos derivados del maíz, como bollos y picadas.  Su meta es incrementar cada vez más sus ventas y dar apertura a un local al público, pero el aumento de sus ventas y el ahorro, se convierten en su mayor desafío. En sus dos años de experiencia, Adelina realiza su tarea diariamente con su clientela,  fabrica bollos de maíz, lo cual aprendió de su madre y requiere de un proceso productivo y también vende mercancía variada, siguiendo el consejo de su amiga, para incrementar el volumen de sus ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, perfumería bolsos  por un lado y maíz, e insumos,por otro  para aumentar la producción de bollos de mazorca. Con esta inversión aspira a hacer más voluminosas sus ventas y sus utilidades , con lo cual  mejorará sustancialmente su negocio.
texts.en:
Adelina is 43 years old.  She lives in a town on the edge of the ocean, where she works selling footwear, perfume, and clothing, and also making corn-based products such as bollos and picadas [traditional Colombian dishes].  Her goal is to continually increase her sales and open a food stand to the public.  However, increasing her sales and saving money are her major challenge.

With two years of experience, Adelina does her work daily for her customers.  She makes corn bollos [Colombian tamales], something that she learned from her mother, requiring a production process.  Following the advice of a friend, she also sells various merchandise in order to increase her income volume.  

Now she is asking for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has requested through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will buy clothing, footwear, perfume, and handbags on the one hand, and corn and ingredients on the other in order to increase her production of corn bollos.  With this investment she aspires to increase her sales and her profits, with which she can improve her business substantially.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, perfume, handbags, corn, and ingredients

loans.name: Magaly Ines

texts.es:
Magaly una mujer de 53 años de edad madre de nada menor que 6 hijos varones, dedica a la cría de cerdos actividad que ejerció pro necesidad económica pues su familia es de bajos recursos tal y como se puede observar en la foto, trabaja todos los días 12 horas, es realmente una mujer que se sacrifica por el bien de los suyos, que sueña con poder realizar mejoras a su humilde vivienda y que un día uno de sus hijos tome ese negocio que los alimento por tantos años, Magaly solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos esperando que este le ayude a aumentar sus clientes, mejorar su ventas, seguir operando en el tiempo. 
Magalyu seguirá trabajando y se compromete a pagar cumplidamente las cuotas su le brindan la confianza prestando en su proyecto.
texts.en:
Magaly is a 53 year-old woman with six sons. She raises pigs for the money, as her family has a limited income. As you can see in the photo, she works every day for 12 hours. She is really a woman who sacrifices herself for the good of her family. She dreams of being able to make improvements to her humble home, and that one day one of her sons takes over her business that provided for them for so many years. 

Magaly is asking for a loan to buy pigs which will hopefully bring more customers and improve her sales so that she can continue operating her business. Magaly will continue working and promises to pay the loan back, which hopefully will give confidence in her project.

loans.use: to buy pigs to maintain her business and to feed her six children.

loans.name: Bertha Edilma

texts.es:
Bertha es una madre de 52 años de edad, que pasó por un difícil momento y fue separarse de su esposo dejándola con dos hijos a cargo y sin saber qué hacer. 
Bertha encontró en la venta de mercancía como productos de uso doméstico una salida económica a su crisis y ahora pide la ayuda a prestatarios de todos los países que la apoyen en su proyecto el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido como lociones, ropa, calzado y cosméticos, con el objetivo de seguir generando recursos para el hogar y que no lleguen a pasar necesidades como hambre, falta de estudio. Etc. 
Bertha con este negocio también espera mejorar su ventas, mejorar su utilidad y salir de la crisis que le genero separarse de su esposo.
texts.en: Bertha is a 52-year-old mother who went through a difficult time and separated from her husband, leaving her with two kids to take care of without knowing what to do. Bertha began selling merchandise such as domestic products, which was a way out of her crisis. She is now asking lenders from all countries to support her in her project. She will invest the loan in the purchase of an assortment of things such as lotions, clothing, shoes and cosmetics, with her objective being to continue generating income for her home without going without necessities like food, schooling, etc. Bertha also hopes to improve her sales and become more useful in order to get out of the crisis that came about after separating from her husband.

loans.use: to buy domestic products such as lotion, perfume, clothing and shoes in order to get out of the crisis that occurred when she separated from her husband.

loans.name: Cara

texts.en:
Cara is single and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Cara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Previous to this loan, Jhona has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jhona aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Luis  es un hombre de 34 años de edad, que habita con su familia  en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, al norte de Colombia;  su hogar está conformado por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 9 a 16 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Su negocio inició hace 3 años, teniendo un pequeño capital y mucho conocimiento en el arte de la tapicería y  remontadora de calzado. Este negocio hoy ha crecido,  teniendo que contratar a empleados productivos. Su meta es continuar su ascenso y lograr una mayor cobertura de clientes, pues su mayor desafío es sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia,  generándole cada vez mayor bienestar. La rentabilidad sobre sus ventas es no inferior al 9%  y sobre el patrimonio no es inferior al 26 % . En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, materia primas como telas para el tapizado de muebles y derivados del cuero, pegante etc, para tener así una mayor productividad y rentabilidad sobre la inversión.
texts.en:
Luis is a 34-year-old man who lives with his family in the city of Cartagena de Indias in the north of Colombia. His household is made up of his wife and their three kids, ages 9 to 16. He hopes to see them become successful people. His business began three years ago with a little money and a lot of knowledge about the art of upholstery and shoe repair. His business has grown and he's had to hire new employees. 

His goal is to continue improving and to gain more customers. His main challenge is moving his sons and his family forward and improving their wellbeing. The return on his sales is no less than 9% and on his assets it's no less than 26%. He's currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this, he will buy raw materials such as fabric for his furniture upholstery, leather by-products, glue, etc. in order to be more productive and to be more profitable from the investment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for furniture upholstery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, potatoes, plantains, yucca, cabbage, sauces, donuts, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Here is Ronel, 36, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Vilma, a massage therapist, and has three children who manage their household and help in his general store. He also has a tricycle unit which he drives for added income.  He is grateful he was previously granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He works hard to continually provide income to meet their family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Ronel now also operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every day. 

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, corn rice, charcoal, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him.

Ronel aims to grow his business to give his family a bright future. He wants to give his children the best education possible. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 15 years. Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like noodles, cooking oil, etc. Grace has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like noodles, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 63 años que junto con su esposa atienden un negocio familiar de venta de productos de belleza, atiende de lunes a sábado en jornada continua, este negocio lo han tenido por muchos años y se sienten bien atendiendo sus clientes con los cuales han tenido una estrecha relación y excelente amistad. 
Mario pensando en los dos eventos que se avecinan como lo son Halloween y día de amor y amistad quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos y artículos comerciales para estas fecha.
Con el crédito espera mejorar su ingresos para la ayuda estudiantil de sus dos hijos, mejoras a su vivienda y a su local comercial y mercancía para seguir creciendo su negocio. 
Su sueño es poder tener salud para seguir trabajando y servir de apoyo para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario, 63, along with his wife attend to a family business in the sale of beauty products.  They are there Monday through Saturday the whole workday.  They have had this business for many years and they feel good serving their customers with whom they have had a close relationship and excellent friendship.
Mario is thinking about two events that are coming up soon which are Halloween and the day of love and friendship.  He wants to request a loan in order to buy supplies and commercial articles for these dates.
With this loan, he hopes to increase his earnings for the assistance of his two children in school, to improve his residence and shop, and to get merchandise to continue growing his business.
His dream is to be able to be healthy in order to continue working and be of support to his family.

loans.use: to buy articles for the love and friendship event and Halloween.  He hopes for profits which will help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Mirando Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
CARLOS vive en Rocafuerte, en una pequeña casa que alquila con su esposa y sus 3 hijos (11-8 años y 4 meses de edades). 
Su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar y sus hijos. Mientras CARLOS recorre las calles con un bolso ofreciendo a sus vecinos amigos y moradores – ropa de damas – caballeros y niños.
Esta actividad de venta de ropa la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 8 años y es la fuente de trabajo que le permite llevar el pan diario y cubrir necesidades de su hogar.
Este es el tercer crédito que CARLOS solicita a FODEMI  con el que comprará ropa para niños y damas la misma que  es vendida más frecuentemente  a demás desea aprovechar la temporada para aumentar sus ventas. 
Tiene sueños y planes de comprar un terreno donde construir su propia casa y de esta forma brindarles comodidad a su esposa y sus hijos. 
Además en su propia casa adecuaría un local para su mercadería y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Esta muy contento con la ayuda que FODEMI brinda a la gente de su comunidad para que tenga un mejor estilo de vida- mediante el desarrollo de sus propias ideas de negocios.

el grupo al que pertenece CARLOS lleva mas de 3 años organizado. realizando actividades de limpieza y mingas en la comunidad. cada integrante tiene un negocio diferente y todos viven en el mismo sector.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in a small home with his wife and 3 children (11 and 8 years old and 4 months old) in Rocafuerte. 

His wife works taking care of the home and the children, while Carlos goes around the streets with a bag offering clothes to his neighbors, friends and inhabitants women's, men's and children's clothing.

He has done this activity of selling clothes for 8 years as an street vendor. it is the source of work that allows him to bring bread to the home.

This is his third loan that Carlos asks with FODEMI, with which he will purchase children's and women's clothing which is most frequently sold and, in addition, to take advantage of the season to increase sales. 

He has dreams and plans to purchase a plot of land where he can build his own house and in this way offer comfort to his wife and children.

In addition to his own house, he would tailor a retail space for his merchandise and offer more comfort to his customers.

He is very happy with the help  FODEMI offers the people of his community so that they have a better lifestyle, through the development of their own business ideas. 

The group in which Carlos belong has been for 3 years,  and it has made activities such as cleaning and working for the community. Each of them has a different business and lives in the same sector.

loans.use: to purchase children's and women's clothing which is most frequently sold and, in addition, to take advantage of the season to increase sales.

loans.name: Jeonidi

texts.en:
Jeonidi is seeking your financial help to buy a diary cow.

He is a 31-year-old married father of 3-year-old twins. He has been farming for a living. Mostly his focus has been on beans, potatoes and red onions as  the region where he lives is prominent for such produce.  Jeonidi, just like others in his region, is not worried about finding clientèle, because wholesale buyers who cover transportation, reach out to pick up the harvests.  

The village where Jeonidi's family lives plants Lima beans and has lots of grapevines as well. In the summer Jeonidi and his wife gather wild or natural medicinal plants and they get paid for this.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam. She is forty-one years old, single and blessed with four children who she lives with.

Mariam earns her living by practicing dairy farming in her village. She joined Hand in Hand in 2014 and has benefited from savings, enterprise and financial management training. She is applying for a loan from Kiva to purchase dairy feed. She looks forward to increased milk production by her dairy cattle thus increasing her income which she hopes to use in educating her children.

Mariam is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Maria Adelina

texts.es:
La señora María de 43 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus hijos  se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de venta de artesanía  su negocio es la  venta de  objetos de barro como jarrones, floreros, jaulas para pájaros, etc.
Doña María sus  clientes son turistas que transitan por el lugar ya que su negocio está a la orilla de la carretera panamericana, esta solicita el préstamo para la compra de objetos de barro como jarrones, jaulas, pintura, etc. para tener más surtido su negocio y así obtener las ganancias necesarias para seguir apoyando a su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras- Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and her children. For the past 15 years, she has made a living through her business selling crafts. Her business is the sale of clay items, such as jugs, vases, cages for birds, etc. Maria's customers are tourists who pass through town, since her business is located at the edge of the Pan-American highway.

She is requesting a loan to buy clay items such as jugs, cages, paints, etc. so that her business has a greater assortment and, in that way, to obtain the earnings necessary to continue supporting her family. Her dream is to improve her business and to improve her quality of life.

San Lorenzo,  Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy jugs, cages, paints, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Merixe

texts.es:
La señora Merixe  de 29  años  de edad es casada  tiene 1 hijo que dependen de ella vive en casa propia  ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de tortillas y también vende golosinas y frescos sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y personas que a diario llegan a su casa a comprar sus tortillas.
Doña Merixe está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal etc. Con el préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener más utilidades desea comprar por al mayor el maíz para trabajar mucho mejor y no tener que comprar a diario la medida  de maíz, espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Su sueño es darle una buena educación a su hijo. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Merixe, 29 years old, is married and has one dependent child. She lives in her own house located in a village in the San Lorenzo valley in southern Honduras, and has worked for the past 3 years selling tortillas and she also sells candies and soft drinks. Her customers are friends, neighbors, and people who come by her house daily to buy tortillas.

Merixe is asking for a loan to purchase corn, firewood, lime, etc. With the loan, she plans to improve her business and have more utility. She wants to purchase corn in bulk to work much better and not have to purchase a measure of corn daily. She hopes that this investment will allow her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family a little.

Her dream is to provide her son with a good education.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ellaine

texts.en:
Ellaine is 34 years old and has tree children, two of whom are in school. Ellaine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Ellaine has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Ellaine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susan is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Susan has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Susan requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 31, is married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Sarah operates a tailoring business. She is borrowing money to purchase textiles. 

She is happy for the enterprise training she has received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. It has helped her gain business 
knowledge and skills in operating her business. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to meet the rising demand for her services. Doing so will raise her income, which will enable her to cater to her family's needs, such as food.
 
Sarah is happy for Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael de 48  años de  edad vive con sus hijos, se dedica desde hace 2  años al negocio de venta de agua en su camión, sus clientes son todas las personas de las colonias, barrios  y comunidades, ofrece buen producto a un precio accesible  y sus clientes lo prefieren bastante por su buena atención
Don Ismael vive en el municipio de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don Ismael ésta solicitando el préstamo para comprar 5 llantas de segunda mano para su carro de trabajo con él préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para seguir apoyando a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Ismael, 48, lives with his children and for two years he has been making a living selling water from his truck.  His customers are all the people from the neighborhoods, subdivisions, and communities.  He offers a good product at an affordable price and his customers prefer him well enough because of his good service.
Ismael lives in the municipality of San Lorenzo in a valley in the south of Honduras.  He is an enterprising man with hopes of getting ahead and he struggles daily to improve the quality of his life.
His dream is to grow his business in order to continue supporting his children.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy five tires for his business.

loans.name: Sally Vilma

texts.es:
Sally es una joven emprendedora, soltera, que vive en San Vicente junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como empelada en una empresa, ella cree que le está yendo bien pos su contante empeño y dedicación al trabajo. También está estudiando una carrera profesional porque quiere tener un futuro mejor.
Su mayor motivación en su vida es su familia, ella quiere mejorar su calidad de vida por eso utilizará el crédito para comprar un juego de muebles para amoblar su casa. Sally está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esta tranquilidad de saber que su familia está bien, podrá seguir estudiando y trabajando para convertirse en una exitosa profesional.
texts.en:
Sally is a young, single entrepreneur who lives in San Vicente with her family. She is very eager to get her family ahead. For the past year she has been employed with a company. Shes believes she is doing well after her constant effort and dedication to her job. She is also studying for a professional career because she wants to have a better future. 

Her main motivation in her life is her family. She wants to improve her quality of life and thus will use the loan to buy a set of furniture to furnish her house. Sally is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants them to know that with this peace of mind her family will be well-off and she will be able to continue studying and working to become a successful professional.

loans.use: Buy a set of furniture for her house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines.

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Phillipine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional bamboo stock for her business.

Erlinda  has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo stock for her business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 37 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for four years.

In the future Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Tamphasana Chanu

texts.en:
"It takes a lot of courage and confidence to achieve one’s goal in life", said 21-year-old Tamphasana, pictured with her uncle. 

She is an energetic and enthusiast person. She has been living with her grandmother and uncle in town in search of a better education since her father passed away when she was in the second standard at school. Her mother has been living in a remote place with her younger sister since then. She was interested in athletics since childhood and started taking an active part in sporting events conducted by the school. She joined Sports Authority of the State during her sixth standard and has been in the state basketball team since then, representing the state in the Basketball National Championship for four times now. She also held the 1st runner-up title in Miss Pineapple Queen back in the year 2011 held in the state. 

She has been in dire need of a job so that she can help her family financially and provide for the family. While she was in search of a job, she got a job as a runway model in town. However, she did not get the proper work and pay because models are not in demand in a small town. The job was not satisfactory so she went for the cabin crew interview held in town and was selected. She was overjoyed with the news but sad at the same time because she did not have money to pay for the refundable security deposit. Her friend who is taking the same loan introduced the WSDS education loan to her and she approached WSDS for financial assistance. With the loan, she will pay the refundable security deposit and join the cabin crew training. She has high hopes for her future endeavor to support her family in financial matters. She expressed her immense gratitude towards WSDS for saving her from financial insecurities. She says, “Thank you Kiva for making my dream a reality.”

loans.use: To pay the security deposit for cabin crew training.

loans.name: Rrok

texts.en:
Rrok is a 58-year-old villager and father of four; 24 is the oldest and 12 the youngest.

He wants to add one more dairy cow to his existing herd of two. Agriculture and livestock have been his way to earn a living.  Added to this, his oldest son has been working lately with a recycling company. 

In the 2 dynym of agricultural land that he owns, Rrok plants mainly fodder, shamrock, clover, beans, corn, and some seasonal veggies. Also, fruit trees such as apples, nuts and grapevines are part of his activity. Rrock sells fresh produce, veggies, fruits and fodder and also raw milk from the cows.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude, 30, is married and blessed with five children. She has been practising poultry keeping and charcoal selling for the past year. 

The training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run her enterprises more effectively. Her businesses have expanded, and she wants to buy more chickens and add to her charcoal stock. 

She hopes her businesses will flourish, hence improve her income. This will ensure that she maintains a steady supply of the market and also support her children's education.  

She appreciates Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To pay for chickens and add to her charcoal stock.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio es un hombre honrado, padre de familia amoroso, siempre dedicándose y esforzándose para que su familia viva bien. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, el principal producto que cultiva en sus terrenos es el cacao, tienen bastantes conocimiento por eso cree que le está yendo bien, por su gran esfuerzo y trabajo.
Patricio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, cubrir los gastos de riego, comprar abono, para así obtener una buena producción en la cosecha, así pues tendrá mayores ingresos con los que podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Patricio is an honorable man and a loving father. He is always dedicating himself and making an effort so that his family can live well. For many years, he has made a living in agriculture. The main product that he cultivates on his lands is cocoa. He is very knowledgeable, and he thinks he is doing well as a result of his great effort and hard work.

Patricio is very grateful for Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him he will be able to maintain his cocoa crops, cover the costs of irrigation, and buy fertilizer in order to obtain a good yield. This way, he will earn a higher income, which will allow him to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his cocoa crops, water his plants, and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a PlayStation game for her rental business.

loans.name: Mrgyn

texts.en:
Mrgyn is 32 years old and has two children who are in school. Mrgyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

Mrgyn has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Mrgyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is a married woman with two children. Adelita is 56 years old and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Adelita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

Adelita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Adelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Rosario is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Cleta

texts.en:
Cleta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

Cleta has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Cleta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: As a married mother of three children, Margret who is 64 years old, works tirelessly to support her family. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 where she gained skills in business management, savings mobilization and financial management; which has helped improve her life. She does both dairy and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a loan to buy manure to help boost her vegetable farming. She hopes her crop yield will improve so she will have a bigger supply for the market. This will lead to more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to provide food, clothing and education for the family. Margret is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Daisy is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for her food production business.

Daisy has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 42 años de edad, habita en un municipio del departamento de Bolivar, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos, en las edades de 2 y 24 años. Como alternativa para generar y aumentar sus ingresos, Rosa se dedicó a la actividad comercial, pero antes habia iniciado su gestión ofreciendo servicios de peluquería , actividad que tambien practica y que decidió fortalecer iniciando su nergocio de tienda. Las ventas de víveres en su tienda las realiza en su mayoria de contado, aunque tambien ofrece unos cuantos créditos a corto plazo.  Sus vecinos del barrio y amigos de los alrededores, son sus principales clientes y  como ya la conocen,  planea como meta incrmentar sus inventarios, para vender mucho mas y tambien agregar productos cárnicos, que  han solicitado sus clientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres y cárnicos , pues necesita incrementar sus ingresos, para apoyar la educacion de su hija, pues finalmente trabajando, piensa que vencerá todos los obstaculos que se le presenten y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old and lives with her domestic partner and two children (ages 2 and 24) in a town in the department of Bolivar. As an alternative way to increase her income, Rosa started a business, but before that she provided hairdressing services. She is still doing this, but has decided to boost her income by opening a store. In her store she sells groceries, mostly for cash, but sometimes she offers short-term credit. Her main customers are her neighbors and friends from her neighborhood and surrounding areas. Since they know her now, her goal is to increase her inventories so she can sell more, and she also wants to add meat products which her customers have requested. 

Rosa is currently asking for a Kiva loan which is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the proceeds to buy groceries and meat products. She will use the added income to support her daughter's education. She feels that now that she is working she will be able to overcome all the obstacles in her way, and this is precisely why her investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy groceries and meat products.

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en:
From the district of Korca, Aferdita is a 41-year-old mother of two children, a 21-year-old and a 15-year-old. She currently has four dairy cows. She also grows lucerne (alfalfa) barley and corn.

Aferdita has found dairy cows profitable, and the farm that she sells the raw milk to is not far from her home, therefore minimizing her transportation costs. She has requested this loan to add two more cows to the herd.  

Says Aferdita:  “I love animals and many times I find myself talking to them non-stop and it is funny. I love looking after them and their babies when they’re born.  I have been doing this for a long time now and never get bored.”

loans.use: to add two more cows to the existing herd of four

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Martha, twenty two years old, single and blessed with one child. She is engaged in both dairy and poultry farming. She also runs a salon in the local shopping centre.

Martha is taking a loan to buy salon items such as weaves, hair gel and shampoo. This will ensure that she has enough stock to enable her to meet customer demand and also compete fairly in the market. She will hence be able to provide consistent services leading to an improved and stable income. She plans to plough back the anticipated profits to aid in expanding her business.

Martha is so grateful to Kiva for assisting her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy salon stock such as hair gel, shampoo and weaves.

loans.name: Kinungi Baraka Women Group

texts.en:
Mercy, whose hand is raised in the photo, is a member of the Kinungi Baraka Women Group. She is forty years old and has six children who are in school. 

Mercy is a vegetable farmer who supplies the neighboring markets. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain more skills in business management, record-keeping and financial management.

She is borrowing a loan to buy certified seeds to help boost her farming by enhancing her crop yield. She hopes for an increase in her supplies, leading to an improved income. This will go a long way in ensuring that she maintains food security in her household and provides her children with quality education.

Mercy is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds.

loans.name: Jose Estanislao

texts.es:
El señor José Estanislao de 26 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos se dedica desde hace 2 anos a la venta de verduras como, tomates, cebollas, repollos, papas, pepinos, zanahorias, manzanas, bananos, etc. Sus clientes son las personas que transitan por la zona, ya que cuenta con un punto estratégico en San Lorenzo, el ofrece buenos productos y buena atención.
Don José Estanislao vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle, al sur de Honduras es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día  a día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don José Estanislao está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio de productos como tomates, cebollas, repollos, papas, zanahorias, plátanos, chiles, etc. Con  él préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras  - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Jose Estanislao is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two kids. He has made a living for the past 2 years selling vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, apples, bananas, etc. His customers are people traveling through the area as San Lorenzo is a prime location. He offers good products and good service. 

Jose Estanislao lives in the city of San Lorenzo Valle, south of Honduras. He is an entrepreneur with a desire to succeed and fights every day to improve his quality of life. José Estanislao is requesting a loan to stock his business with products such as tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, carrots, bananas, peppers, etc. With the loan he expects to improve his income and his quality of life. His dream is to grow with his business in order to improve his quality of life. 

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras  - September 2014.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, cabbage, potatoes, carrots, bananas, peppers, etc. for his business

loans.name: Julia Saturnina

texts.es: la señora julia es habitante de chinandega cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de fresco desde hace 6 años ella es ina mujer trabajaora, responsable que inicia su dia de trabajo a partir de la 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde la señora solicita financiamiento cada tres meses para invertir en su negocio ella compra frutas y azucar por mayor  para realizar sus refrescos y obtener mas ganacias para el sustento de su casa.
texts.en: Julia is a resident of Chinandega.  She's had a small business selling beverages for 6 years.  She is a hardworking woman who is responsible.  She starts her day at 7am and works until 3pm.  Julia is requesting financing every 3 months to invest in her business by purchasing fruits and sugar at wholesale to use in making her drinks.  This way, she can obtain more earnings to support her household.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for making drinks.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aún viven en su casa y uno de ellos  estudian en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña María para ganar sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su familia hace 4 años atrás puso un bar en su casa, luego de unos mese también adecuo otro local en el cual puso un cibert y un bazar, allí además de brindar el servicio de internet y trabajos en computadoras también vende ciertos útiles escolares, entre otras cosas que le ayudan a ganar algo extra por el bien de su familia, en su bar ella vende bocadillos, jugos, y batidos de frutas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta un poquito más tarde sobre todo los fines de semana, trabaja con la ayuda de una de sus hijas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio, va a pagar el servicio de internet y comprar artículos de bazar. Ella está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.  Sus sueños es que su negocio siga creciendo con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The "Honduras 2000" communal bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches along the coast of this lovely area. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and dedicated to working in the sea. 

In this place, we meet María, who is 55 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has seven children, all of them grown. Three of them still live in her home, and one is studying at the university. Her husband is a fisherman. To earn her own income to help her family, Maria started up a bar in her home 4 years ago.  After a few months, she also started up another business consisting of a general store and an internet cafe. There, in addition to selling internet services and computer-related services, she also sells some school supplies and other items to help earn something extra for her family.   In the bar, she sells snacks, juices and fruit shakes.  She works every day from 8:00 to 6:00, and sometimes a bit later, especially on weekends. One of her daughters also helps her with her work. 

Maria will use this loan to stock her business with more products, to pay for internet service, and to buy some products for her general store.  She's been with her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the helpful loans that they receive.  Her dream is to grow her business over time.

loans.use: to pay for internet service and to buy products for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as foliar fertilizers, manure, Urea 46N and complete fertilizer.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 46 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, sacks of rice and charcoal, dozens of eggs, groceries, etc.

Amalia has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Amalia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, sacks of rice and charcoal, dozens of eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling lumber in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years, and earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.

Cecelia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sizes of lumber to sell. Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sizes of lumber to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 35 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Irene has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling rice and pig fattening.

Irene has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as spices, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell. Irene has previously borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF. Irene aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as spices, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Judith works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. 

Judith is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business. Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Mileydys

texts.es: Myleydis de 20 años de edad, vende ropa, accesorios y prendas desde hace 1 año; su negocio lo inició gracias a a que su tia le dió la idea de invertrir en mercancia variada, como una forma de generar y aumentar gradualmente sus ingresos. Así lo hio y con la primera inversión sus  utilidades le sirvieron para resolver los gastos de transporte y sus gastos personales, poco a poco ha ido creciendo y tiene mucho ánimo de hacer crecer su negocio cada vez mas, porque necesita generar mas ingresos,  para pudiendo pagar su universidad, ser una profesional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual compará queso, ropa interior, para continuar ofreciendo casa a casa persona a persona su mercancia  e impactar a su clientela y ganar un poco mas. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, en tanto a que obtendria una mayor rentabilidad por la disminución de sus costos de venta, debido a que el volumen de sus compras aumenta y obtendria mejores precios, que cuando compra al detalle; Todo esto haria de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Myleydis, who is 20, has been selling clothing, accessories and garments, for a year now.

Her aunt gave her the idea of investing in a variety of merchandise as a way of generating and gradually increasing her income, and that's how she started her business. The profits from her first investment were used to cover her transportation and personal expenses.

The business has been gradually growing and she's very motivated to promote further growth, because she needs to generate more income to be able to pay for her college education so that she may become a professional.

She's currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy cheese, undergarments, in order to continue to offer her merchandise door-to-door, person to person, to make an impact on her customers and to earn a little more.

With this investment her business will improve. She will get better profits as her sales costs decrease, because she will buy in greater volume and at better prices than retail, thereby making her loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy cheese, undergarments.

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Leonardo  es habitante de la ciudad de chinandega es casado el tiene cuatro hijo de los cuales no tiene a cargo a ninguno  ya que estos estan casados  el cuenta con un negocio de articulos de ferreteria en el mercado municipal de chinandega  desde hace 40 años el inicia un dia de trabajo desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm de lunes a domingo. El señor leonardo solicita financiamiento cada 2 meses para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio en esta ocasion el compro fajas de cuero, candados, arandelas,aldabas etc.
texts.en:
Leonardo  lives in Chinandega. He is married and has four children, but they are all married and no longer depend on him. 

He has had a hardware stall in the Chinandega municipal market for the past 40 years. His work day starts at 7 a.m. and ends at 5 p.m., Monday through Sunday. Leonardo asks for financing every two months so he can buy merchandise for his business. At this time he is buying leather belts, padlocks, washers, door latches, etc.

loans.use: to buy items for a hardware store, such as plugs, lamps, hoses, keys, padlocks and pliers.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As the married parent of eight children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ice cream vending. Melinda is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase plastic bags, purified water, etc. for her business buying and selling frozen products.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, purified water, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou, 43 years old, is married and has four children, three of them in school. Marilou has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Marilou is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en: Maurecia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 20 years, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. Maurecia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as milk, flour, sugar, yeast, food coloring, etc. In the future, Maurecia would like to save money to put up a general store.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as milk, flour, sugar, yeast, food coloring, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nenita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business buying and selling rice grains.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Perlita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat. Perlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business like flour, milk, sugar, vanilla, etc.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business like flour, milk, sugar, vanilla, etc.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rechel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and selling dried fish. Rechel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing netting for her fishing business.

Rechel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing netting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria, who is married and has had a firewood sales business in the Philippines for 10 years now, works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Gregoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Sandra Mariela

texts.es: La señora sandra es habitante de la ciudad de chinandega  ella vive en una comunidad carretera a corinto es casada tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar ella cuenta su negocio de venta de leche y cuajada en su casa de habitacion ella solicito financiamiento para la compra de mas cuajada ya que la esta vendiendo por mayor es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in the city of Chinandega. She lives in a community near the highway, Corinto. She is married and has two school-age children. She makes a living from her business selling milk and curds from her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy more curds, since she sells wholesale. She is a hard-working woman who is fighting to move her two children forward.

loans.use: to buy basic materials.

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
Rosy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Rosy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rosy has been in this business for twelve years. Rosy earns more income from selling dried fresh.

Rosy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Aurel

texts.en:
Aurel has two children, three and one years old. Raising livestock and farming have been his preferred activities to earn a decent living for some time now. In addition to goats, whose milk he sells to nearby farms, he also raises cows whose milk is consumed at home.

On his farmland, Aurel plants beans and medicinal plants including black marshmallow or Malvae Herba.  His produce is usually bought by wholesalers.

Aurel wants to add more goats to his herd and so has requested a loan of 250,000 Albanian Leks. He is counting on Kiva lenders to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to add more goats to his existing herd

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilia is 37 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Lilia has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Lilia requested a 19,500-PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel, 49, is a married woman. She has one child who attends school.

Ma. Isabel is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, she has run a food vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Ma. Isabel would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela, a married woman, works hard to support her family. For the past eight years, she has operated a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the Philippines.

For the past ten years, Marilou has earned a living by raising and fattening pigs. She also earns additional income from selling food. Currently, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Marilou is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 36 years old, single and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Annaliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  buy fishing nets and wood, nails and paint for making repairs for her fishing business.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and wood, nails and paint for making repairs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marites is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building her house and to paint the walls.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers at her fish vending business.

Niña has been in this business for 15 years. Niña earns more income from pig fattening.

Niña has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмиле 32 года. Она — замужем, дети — школьники. Людмила 12 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством в с.Гладковка. На 1.1 га в теплицах и закрытом грунте она выращивает ранние культуры: помидоры, огурцы, перец и картофель. 
Сумму в 40 000 гривен хочет вложить в закупку расходных материалов, а именно — полиэтиленовой пленки, семян для посева, дров для обогрева теплиц. Людмила хочет подготовить теплицы к сезону, отремонтировать их, посадить ранний редис, помидоры, баклажаны, перец и огурцы, заработав тем самым на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en: Ludmila is 32, married, and has children who are currently in grade school.  For 12 years, she has been a greenhouse farmer in Gladkovka, growing early varieties of tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and potatoes on her 1.1 hectares of land.  She is seeking a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to buy farming supplies; namely, plastic film, seeds for sowing, and wood for heating her greenhouses.  She wants to prepare her greenhouses for the upcoming planting season by doing maintenance on them, as well as sowing early varieties of radishes, tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, and cucumbers, which will help her provide for the needs of her family and business.

loans.use: fix her greenhouses and buy seeds, wood, and plastic film to use as a covering

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita is 63 years old and married with two children. Pelita works very hard to provide for them.

Pelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Pelita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc. 

Pelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Pilar works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Pilar is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, spices, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Pilar has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, spices, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Janera

texts.en:
Janera is 50 years old, married, and has six children. Three of her children are in school. Janera works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Janera is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, including shampoo and groceries.

In the future, Janera would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosario has been in this business for six years. Rosario earns more income from a general store.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married and works hard to support her family. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. Narcisa is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Narcisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marila

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marila works hard to support her family.

Marila runs a business selling rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from fattening goats. Currently, Marila is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Marila has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Adonis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Adonis de  41  años de edad vive con su esposa y tiene dos hijos que depende de él vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras  y se dedica desde hace 20 años  al negocio de pesca artesanal  en su actividad  sale todos los días muy temprano  al mar a pescar sus productos que luego por las tardes entrega a sus clientes  y en su casa  el tiene otro negocio que vende frescos, hielo, jugos y choco bananos.
Don Adonis está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de dos redes  ya que con el préstamo desea mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida 
Su sueño es mejorar su equipo de trabajo y su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Adonis, aged 41, lives with his wife and his 2 dependent children.  They live in the community of San Lorenzo, in the Valle Department in the southern part of Honduras.  For 20 years, he has been a fisherman.  He goes out each day very early to the sea to fish for his products, which he delivers later to his customers in the afternoon.  Also, he has another business in his house where he sells beverages, ice, juices, and chocolate bananas.  

Adonis is requesting a loan to buy two nets, because with this loan he wants to increase his income and also his quality of life.  His dream is to upgrade his work equipment and also his house.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy 2 fishing nets for his business

loans.name: Ana Evangelina
