loans.name: Ziakoulouhak

texts.fr: Père de 02 enfants de 8 et 5ans scolarisés, Ziakoulouhak âgé de 33ans est marié. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il élève et vend en même temps des moutons. Activité qu'elle exerce à SOKODE. Pour son second crédit, il espère acheter plus de moutons afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il souhaite avoir le monopole sur le marché et subvenir aux besoins pressant de la famille.
texts.en:
Ziakoulouhak, age 33, is married and the father of two children, who are eight and five years old. Both go to school.

To provide for his family, he raises and sells sheep in Sokode. With this second loan, he hopes to buy more sheep in order to answer customers' needs.

He wishes to get a monopoly on the market and provide for his family's urgent needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Karoll

texts.es: Karoll de 32 años de edad se dedica al comercio de variedades, perfumería y cosmético, desde el año 2007, cuando vendiendo pocos artículos económicos, construyó su primer grupo de clientes, con los que trabajando logró progresar, hasta organizarse mejor y ampliar sus sueños de fortalecer su negocio, con más capital de trabajo , que es su mayor desafío, en cuanto a que ha realizado muchos créditos a sus clientes y sus cuentas por cobrar las recupera más lentamente, que lo que se incrementan sus nuevos compradores, teniendo que acudir a comprar una parte de su mercancía a crédito , sin lograr los mejores descuentos. Se acerca la temporada de mayor movimiento comercial y Karoll necesita incrementar sus ingresos, por eso debe tener inventarios suficientes,  para satisfacer la demanda de ropa, calzado, cosmético, perfumes y en general para poder  surtir su negocio basada en lo que su cliente le solicita, pero su dinero no es suficiente para lograrlo. Ella está aplicando a un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará  mercancía, y así poder dar gusto a sus clientes, para que estos disfruten las navidades y el año nuevo, vestidos de manera elegante y muy felices,  bailando entre pitos y matracas, entre música y sonrisas, esperando que  el reloj ya les avise que ha llegado un año más, mientras Karoll,  su cónyuge y sus hijos de 13 y 14 años, también disfrutarán del nuevo ingreso, por concepto de ventas, que sumado a lo que genera su esposo, dará bienestar y felicidad, y esta familia también se sumara  a estas celebraciones de integración familiar y que une toda la vecindad  en  el barrio donde habitan.
texts.en:
Karoll, age 32, sells a variety of items such as perfumes and cosmetics. She has been doing this since 2007, when she built up her first client base by selling a few cheap items. With her income she was able to progress and become better organized. She has been able to meet her dreams of strengthening her business with more working capital, which is her greatest challenge. She has given many loans to her customers, so she recovers money more slowly. Her new buyers add to her sales who buy on credit without getting a discount.
The season of greater commercial movement is approaching and Karoll needs to increase her income. For this, she needs to have sufficient inventory to satisfy the demand for clothing, shoes, cosmetics and perfumes and in general to stock her business with what her clients are requesting. Her money is not sufficient to do this. She is requesting a loan from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, her first loan on Kiva, which she will use to buy merchandise in order to satisfy her customers during the Christmas and New Year season. Her customers will be able to enjoy this season by dressing elegantly and happily, dancing among horns and matracas, among music and smiles, waiting for the clock to tell them that a new year has arrived. Meanwhile Karoll, her husband, and her children ages 13 and 14 will also enjoy a new income from these sales, which will be added to her husband's income. This will give them well-being and happiness. Then this family will also join the family celebrations with everyone in their neighbourhood.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 73 years old and widowed, with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rufina is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rufina has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Malou works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and farming rice. Malou is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle used in her motorcycle transport business.

Malou has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is single and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her business, like thread, fabric, and zippers.

Josephine has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, like thread, fabric, and zippers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and married, with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig-fattening for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salissou

texts.fr: Conducteur de taxi - moto depuis 2003 à SOKODE, Salissou désire acheter une nouvelle moto pour cela, elle fait un second prêt à WAGES. Il souhaite devenir prestataire de service taxi- moto et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Marié, il est père de famille et âgé de 31ans.
texts.en:
Salissou has been driving a motorcycle taxi in Sokode since 2003. He wishes to buy a new motorcycle, which is the reason why he is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES.

He would like to become a motorcycle taxi service provider and improve the standard of living of his family. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of a family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Margelina

texts.en:
Margelina is 59 years old and widowed with four children.

Margelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Margelina has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and farming vegetables.

Margelina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is single and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Alice requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Alice has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Alice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alen

texts.en:
Alen is 42 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alen has a selling used clothing business in the Philippines. Alen requested a PHP 12,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Alen has been in this business for 6 years. Alen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Marita

texts.en:
Ana Marita is 57 years old and has five children. Ana Marita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Ana Marita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana Marita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Marita has been raising pigs for 24 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ana Marita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:

Levy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Levy has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, detergent soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Levy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Analiza

Analiza has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Analiza aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cirila aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, juice, coffee, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Crecenciana

Crecenciana works hard to support her family. Crecenciana is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Crecenciana requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Crecenciana has been in this business for 10 years now.

Crecenciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 58 years old and married, with six children. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, face powder, noodles, and canned goods.

Elsa has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, face powder, noodles, and canned goods. 

Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, face powder, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia works hard to support her family and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Emilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

Emilia has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business, selling soft drinks and beer in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beer to sell through her soft drinks and beer business.

Emma has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks and beer to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario  (Charapoto) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Karla, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta  relación tiene un hijo de 1 año y 6 meses. El marido es militar.
Doña Karla en con la finalidad de ganar algo se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja tres o cuatro  días por semana, sale en las mañanas ya que a esta hora se le hace más fácil realizar su labor, ella deja a crédito y cobra por semana, Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva tres ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito   y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Virgen del Rosario Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Charapoto, a place known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This small group of people decided to get together a while ago to form this communal bank.  It has served them well because with the loans they have improved their small businesses and their lives.  They earn a living in a variety of jobs, including agriculture, general commerce, and service.

One of the members of this group is Karla, 21.  She's married and they have a one-and-a-half year old child.  Her husband's a soldier.

Karla sells all types of clothing to earn some money.  She sells door-to-door as well as at home, where she receives her customers.  She works three or four days a week.  She goes out in the morning because it's easier to do her job at that hour.  She leaves items on credit and collects weekly.  She has been doing this job for a year and it's going very well for her.

She's going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

Karla has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because of the help it offers with the loans.  Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 51 years old and married, with eight children.

Estela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Estela has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from direct-selling personal collection products.

Estela aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ramrio

texts.es: Ramiro de 44 años de edad vende carnes al por mayor, desde el año 2009,  aunque su experiencia data de hace 28 años, cuando en una tierra llamada Barichara en el departamento de Santander, trabajó en tiendas y carnicerías donde aprendió el oficio. Hace 5 años se independizó y se convirtió en un distribuidor de carnes en un amplio sector del suroccidente de la ciudad. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio y ofrecer estudios universitarios a su hijo de 16 años de edad.  En la actualidad Ramiro piensa que es la mejor temporada para invertir, pues se acerca el mes Diciembre y con él sus fiestas, en las que el dinero rota de mano en mano rápidamente  y es especial para fortalecer los negocios, como lo quiere hacer Ramiro aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carnes al por mayor, inversión que lo ayuda a capitalizar su negocio y a tener un más amplio surtido, mejorando así las condiciones de este y el aumento de sus ingresos los cuales repercuten en el bienestar de su hogar.
texts.en: Ramiro is 44 years old and sells meat in bulk.  He has been working in this field since 2009, although his experience dates from 28 years back when he began working in a region known as Barichara in Santander, where he labored in butcher shops and learned his trade.  He became independent 5 years ago and became a distributor of meat for a large region in the southwest of his city.  His future goal is to have his own shop and to provide university studies for his 16 year old child.  Currently Ramiro thinks it is the right time to invest.  December is approaching, and with it a lot of parties.  At these parties money rotates from hand to hand and it is important to strengthen businesses, which is what Ramiro wants to do via Kiva.  This will be his first loan, which he is requesting through Kiva partner Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will buy meat in bulk, which will help him to capitalize his business and have a larger supply.  This will improve his situation and increase his income which will positively impact his family.

loans.use: To purchase meats in bulk.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a married woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Annabel has a furniture business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials needed for her furniture-making business.

Annabel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beef and creole chicken in bulk

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 34 years old and married, with two children who are in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business.

Cheryl has been the business for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 33 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Analie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analie has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ilba

texts.es: Ilba de 24 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de ropa, calzado, perfumería, cosmético y variedades de artículos en general. Ella emprendió esta actividad en el año 2011, cuando debió retirarse de un almacén de venta de calzado, para velar más de cerca, por el cuidado y educación sus hijas, hoy  en las edades de 3 y 4 años. Así fue, como desde su casa, Ilba  empezó a comercializar ropa, calzado y todo lo que su clientela le solicitaba, poco a poco su negocio creció y hoy su meta no se detiene, aunque tenga el desafío de lograr  un capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a los pedidos que hace su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías adaptadas a la temporada de fin de año, como ropa y calzado elegante, accesorios navideños, juguetes y detalles, para que su clientela encuentre todo lo que está buscando, ajustado a la moda de la temporada y haga sus compras  en el negocio de Ilba, mientras esta aumenta sus ingresos que benefician a sus 2 hijas, porque en su condición de mujer separada requieren un mayor esfuerzo, en su educación y el logro de su bienestar y éxito futuro.
texts.en:
Ilba is 24 years old and works selling clothing, footwear, perfume, cosmetics and a variety of other articles. She started this activity in 2011 when she had to quit her job at a store selling shoes in order be at hand to supervise the care and education of her children who today are aged 3 and 4. So from her house Ilba started to sell clothing, footwear and everything that her clients asked her for. Little by little her business grew and today her goals remain constant although her challenge is to amass enough working capital to respond to the requests of her customers.

This is the reason she has requested a loan from Kiva the first loan that she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy merchandise for the end of year celebrations such as clothing, elegant footwear Christmas accessories, toys, etc. So her clientele can find everything they want, according to the fashions of the season and make their purchases at Ilba's business. This will increase her revenues and benefit her two children in their education, their well-being and their future success. Being a single mother a major effort is required to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the end of the year celebrations, like clothing and elegant footwear, Christmas accessories, toys, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Daylin has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Daylin has been in this business for two years. In the future, Daylin would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Dioncy

texts.en:
Dioncy is a married woman with four children. She is 39 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dioncy has a furniture business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed in her furniture making business.

Dioncy has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Dioncy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in her furniture making business

loans.name: Edden

texts.en:
Edden is 35 years old and  has four children three of whom are in school, Edden works very hard to provide for them.

Edden runs a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Edden has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Edden would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en:
Hedaya is a 19-year-old single young lady from Ramallah City. She took some training in graphic design, and now she works for a local company. She has very good experience now. Hedaya would like to improve herself and the quality of her work. 

Hedaya took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her work. By taking this loan, Hedaya will be able to improve her work. 

Hedaya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her work.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carren is 30 years old ,and one of her children is in school.

Carren has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Carren has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José de 50 años de edad  se dedica a la venta de pescado; él aprovechando su conocimiento sobre este productos, pues su padre le enseñó todo lo concerniente a la pesca y el cuidado del pescado; como toda su vida ha vivido en medio del pescado,  aprovechó esta experiencia para convertirla en su propio generador de ingresos. Así como va por todas las calles de su vecindad con su carreta llena de pescado entre los vecinos de su sector, también vende hortalizas  frescas, trabajando de lunes a domingos, en un horario que va desde las 2:00 A.M. hasta las 10 de la mañana. su meta es tener su propio expendio y más adelante mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda. José piensa que su negocio es aun muy pequeño y su desafío es hacerlo crecer, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pescado en un mayor volumen, para vender mas, ganar mas y poder ahorrar, con el fin de poco a poco lograr sus muchos sueños de prosperidad para él y su familia..
texts.en:
José is 50 years old and is a fish monger, a trade he learned from his father.  He has lived his entire life around this industry and his father taught him everything about it. He uses this knowledge to his advantage in his work and has turned his experience into his own income generator. 

He takes his fish-filled cart through the streets of his neighborhood selling to his neighbors.  He also sells fresh vegetables and works from Monday through Sunday from 2:00 a.m. until 10 a.m. His goal is to have his own small shop and to improve the condition of his home later on. 

Jose thinks that his business is still very small and his challenge is to make it grow. This is why he is asking for a Kiva loan which is the first one he is doing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy fish in larger quantities so he can sell more, make more, and save more, slowly achieving his dream of prosperity for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy fish in larger quantities.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 41-year-old, married woman from Khanyounis City. She is a mother of four sons and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs.

Hanan opened a grocery store a few years ago, where she sells consumption products and some gifts. It is a good business and earns a good income.

Hanan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy more items to sell in her grocery store. By taking this loan, Hanan will be able to increase her sales and also her income. 

Hanan appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 22 años de edad trabaja las artesanías de manera formidable. Ella elabora con sus propias manos, moños, cintillas, vinchas, borda ropa y produce ajuar de bebe. Su negocio lo inició en el año 2010, cuando llegó a aprenderlo de sus suegros, pues viéndolos trabajar se entusiasmó y decidió apoyarlos y aprender; con ellos, sus suegros,  ha logrado experiencia y en la actualidad trabaja de la mano de su suegra. Sus ventas las realiza a almacenes especializados en ajuares de bebes y en accesorios para niñas,  y las hace principalmente a crédito y  de contado, recuperando la inversión semanalmente y para ello trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, incluyendo los intermedios de descanso para su alimentación. Su meta es comprar una maquina bordadora, pues sus planes de crecimiento son muy amplios, ya que con su cónyuge, planea comprar su vivienda, para brindarle a su hijo, hoy de dos años, un mayor bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina bordadora, materias primas e insumos para darle una mayor calidad a sus prendas, ofrecer mayor innovación a su clientela e incrementar la productividad, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and works making some amazing handicrafts. With her own hands she works making bows, ribbons, hair bands, embroidered clothing and baby clothing products. She started her business in 2010 when she learned from her in-laws. She got interested watching them work and decided to help them and learn the trade. She has gained experience and now works with her mother-in-law.

She sells her product to the stores that specialize in clothing sets for children and children's accessories mainly on credit and in cash. She collects the money weekly. She works from 9 in the morning until 8 in the evening, including the breaks she takes for meals. Her goal is to buy an embroidery machine as she has many plans to expand. She plans to buy a house with her husband to provide her two year old son with better well-being.

At the present time she is requesting a loan from Kiva the first that she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will purchase an embroidery machine, raw materials and supplies to provide better quality clothing, more innovation to her clients and increase her production. This will make it a successful loan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es: La madre de Emmanuel vendía sopas en un parque, muy cerca al lugar donde vivía y Emmanuel la ayudaba a servir y a atender la clientela. Una vez su madre empezó a trabajar  en una empresa, dejó el negocio en manos de Emmanuel, para que obtuviera sus propios ingresos. Muy pronto su negocio fue creciendo y cuando posteriormente se trasladó a otro barrio, donde aún habita, emprendió su negocio en un local ubicado en su propia vivienda.  Hoy cuenta con una empleada y es apoyado por su madre los fines de semanas y días festivos. Su negocio ha crecido, así como la meta de seguir ascendiendo por parte  de Emmanuel., pues tiene el desafío de terminar su carrera universitaria y tener mucho más estructurado su restaurante. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 2 licuadoras, frutas, panes y jugos, agregar la venta de desayunos, que se ha convertido en una necesidad en el sector que tiene gran potencialidad, para acceder al servicio de alimentos. Su negocio se impactará positivamente pues diversificará su oferta con un producto que lo requiere la comunidad y que no existe aún, lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Emmanuel's mother used to sell soup in a nearby park, and he used to help her serve customers. However, once she began a job with a company, she left the business for Emmanuel to look after so that he would have income of his own. Soon the business was growing and when he moved to another neighbourhood, he also moved the business and now runs it from his house. Now he employs someone to help him and his mother also helps at weekends.

As his business has grown, so has Emmanuel's desire to continue making progress. He has the challenge of completing his university courses and better equipping the restaurant. He is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first he has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He wishes to buy two blenders, fruit, bread, and juice so that he can also serve breakfasts. There is a great potential for such a service in his area. As a result, there will be a positive impact on his business. Later he will diversify and offer yet  other products as needed in the community. The loan should prove to be a successful investment for Emmanuel.

loans.use: Buy two blenders, fruit, bread and juice

loans.name: Izz Eddin

texts.en:
Izz Eddin is a 19-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. His father is an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. Izz opened a workshop for repairing electrical home appliances. It is a good business and helps to support his family by paying part of their expenses.
Izz took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more repair parts for his workshop. By taking out this loan, Izz will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.
Izz appears in the photo in his store

loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 47 years old and married with nine children. Six of her children are in school, and Charita works very hard to provide for them.

Charita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods and more.

Charita has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Charita would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods and more.

loans.name: Charry

texts.en:
Charry is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charry is 37 years old, and her four children are in school.

Charry has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell.

Charry has been in this business for two years. In the future, Charry would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is 34 years old and married with five children, four in school. Jacquelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Jacquelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries..

Jacquelyn has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Jacquelyn would like to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Daisy Len

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Daisy Len works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Daisy Len is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline, and bamboo for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Daisy Len has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline, and bamboo.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 57 years old and married with four children, three in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and chips.

Rosalina has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Rosalina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, and chips

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Agnes works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Agnes is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, paints, and bamboo for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Agnes has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, paints, and bamboo for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es: Hace un año, Emilce llegó al barrio donde habita y se dio cuenta que no había restaurante por ningún lado. Ella muy emprendedora, decidió aprovechar su experiencia de 18 años en la elaboración de comidas y la puso al servicio de la comunidad, para lograr un doble propósito generar ingresos y satisfacer la demanda dela comunidad. Entre sus productos están los desayunos, las meriendas, los almuerzos etc los cuales vende a crédito y de contado  principalmente a vecinos del sector , para quienes compra los insumos diariamente a mayoristas, con el fin de obtener descuentos que aplica a los precios de ventas y logra ser mas competitiva, pero su poco capital no le alcanza para comprar semanalmente teniendo que hacerlo con una frecuencia diaria, con lo cual incurre en muchos mas gastos o. Su día laboral inicia desde muy temprano y solo termina a las 3 de la tarde, pues su meta es tener un local de mayor tamaño para ofrecer y disfrutar de mejores condiciones en su infraestructura. La falta de dinero para lograr sus propósitos es su mayor desafío, pero ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, como arroz, aceite, verduras, cárnicos etc. Con este recurso Emilce solucionará sus dificultades en la compra diaria y la realizará semanalmente, logrando mejores precios y menos gastos de transporte lo que se constituye en el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
One year ago Emilce arrived in the neighborhood where she now lives and says there was no restaurant to be found. She is very enterprising and she decided to take advantage of her 18 years of experience in preparing food and put it to the service of the community. This would achieve a double purpose, create income and satisfy a demand of the community.

Amongst her products are breakfast, snacks and lunch, etc. which she sells on credit and in cash mainly to the residents of her area. She buys her supplies daily from wholesalers with the goal of obtaining discounts that she can apply to the prices of the meals and be more competitive. The little capital she has is not sufficient to buy weekly so she has to buy daily which costs her much more money. She starts her work day very early and finishes at 3 in the afternoon.

Her goal is to have a bigger place to offer better conditions with her infrastructure and to take advantage of them. The lack of funds to achieve her goals is her major challenge so she has requested a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy food such as rice, oil, vegetables, meat, etc. With this resource Emilce will solve her problems with buying daily and do it weekly, getting better prices and less transportation costs which will make this a successful loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies like rice, oil, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing, footwear, cologne, and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist with marketing costs and investment in productions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop her 2014-15 collection of bridal, evening and girls party dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks for her barn and a fence.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 19 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy canned goods, soap, noodles, sugar, and coffee to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, noodles, sugar, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madonna works hard to support her family. Madonna is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Madonna has been in this business for six years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Madonna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Femirose

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Femirose works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and a general store. Femirose is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Femirose has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 33 years old with two children.

Madelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials.

Madelyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the fishing business for 16 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Madelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Hariet

texts.en:
Hariet is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Hariet runs a buy-and-sell seaweed business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of seaweed to sell.

Hariet has previously borrowed and successfully repaid 20 loans from NWTF. She has been running her buy-and-sell seaweed business for 2 years. She also earns income from farming vegetables and running a general store.

Hariet aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Mailyn has been in this business for five years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married with eleven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from raising pigs and fishing.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Clarivel

texts.es: A Clarivel, su prima le aconsejó generar ingresos mediante una actividad comercial, sugerencia que con mucho criterio acogió en el año 2012, cuando emprendió su negocio de venta de todo tipo de mercancía, solicitada por su clientela, alcanzando una buena acogida entre ella. Hoy su meta de hacer crecer su negocio no se detiene y sueña con abrir un local al público, ahorrar para tener su propia casa,  aunque tenga un gran desafío, que no es otro que el de fidelizar a su clientela e incrementar sus ventas, para obtener mucha mas ganancia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, perfumes, colonia, cremas, con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, porque logrará impactar su mercado, aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades, que así mismo beneficiaran el ingreso familiar y el desarrollo de su hogar.
texts.en: Clarivel's cousin advised her to generate income through commerce, and she took this advice in 2012 when she started her business of selling all types of merchandise requested by her customers. Her products were well accepted by them. Nowadays, her goal is to make her business grow. She is unstoppable, and she dreams with opening a store to the public, and saving to buy a house. Her greatest challenge is to be loyal to her customers and increase her sales in order to have more earnings. Currently, she is requesting her first Kiva loan to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy clothing, perfumes, cologne, creams. With this investment her business will improve, because she will be able to affect her market, increase her sales and profits, and this will also benefit her family income and the development of her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, colognes, creams.

loans.name: Doris Leticia

texts.es: Doris, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada, tiene cinco hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 4 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada como camisas, jeans, short, blusas, faldas, etc. Este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante y por pedidos. Doris, es muy trabajadora quiere tener siempre una fuente de ingresos para la familia. El prestamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería para el negocio como pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisas, calcetines, shorts etc.y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos ya que tendrá mas surtido y va poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Su meta es brindar el apoyo a sus hijos con la educación y mantener el negocio para cambiar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Doris is 39 years old. She is married, has five children, and lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. For four years, she has earned her living selling new and used clothing like shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses, skirts, etc. She conducts her business as a street vendor and by orders. 

Doris is very hardworking and wants to always have a source of income for the family. The loan that she is requesting is for 6,000 lempiras [HNL]; she is going to invest it in the purchase of more merchandise for her business, like pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, socks, shorts, etc. Then she can earn a better income since she will have more inventory and will be able to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Her goal is to support her children's education and maintain her business in order to change her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing like pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, socks, shorts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ascion

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ascion works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling recycled materials.  Ascion is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell for her vegetable sales business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ascion has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables for her business to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for 10 years. Antonieta earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 26 years old and married with two children who are in school. Eden works very hard to provide for them.

Eden runs a rice retailing  business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Eden has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Eden would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products, perfume, clothes, and underwear.

loans.name: Yurney

texts.es: Yurney de 27 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa, mecatos y yogur desde al año 2012, en su propia casa, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 11 años de edad.  Su negocio lo inició Yurney, por sugerencia de su hermana, quien le propuso vender ropa producida en su taller de confecciones. La idea resultó muy exitosa y por eso Yurney no se detiene. Su meta actual es ampliar el surtido y mas adelante remodelar su vivienda; su mayor desafío es fidelizar a su clientela con productos de calidad, a buenos precios y con un servicio excepcional.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  camisetas, sueteres, jeans, ropa infantil, además de pasabocas y yogur, que son los productos alimenticios que le generan un ingreso adicional. Con esta inversión Yurney incrementará el surtido, aumentará sus ventas y con ello vendrán muchas mas utilidades, porque su mercado conoce que ella atiende diariamente de lunes a domingos, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y esto hace que tenga una clientela fija, con la cual contar para lograr vender permanentemente y alcanzar poco a poco sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Yurney is 27 years old and has been selling clothing, snacks, and yogurt since 2012 out of her own house where she lives with her life partner and their three children who range in age from 4 to 11. 

Yurney started her business at the suggestion of her sister who proposed that she sell clothing made in her clothing shop. The idea was very successful, and Yurney hasn't stopped there. Her present goal is to expand her assortment and later on to remodel her home. Her biggest challenge is to retain her customers by offering quality products at good prices and with exceptional service.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan which is her first one with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and will use the money to buy t-shirts, sweaters, jeans, and children's clothing, She will also buy snacks and yogurt which are food items that generate additional income. This investment will allow Yurney to expand her assortment, increase sales and have much higher profits, because her market knows that she tends her store daily from Monday to Sunday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. She will do this until she has a steady clientele she can count on so she can sell permanently, and slowly attain her dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, sweaters, jeans, children's clothing, and also snacks and yogurt.

loans.name: Jose Candido

texts.es: Don José, tiene 60 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene 4 hijos, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira. El toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia. Hace 15 años que cultiva café ya que es la mayor fuente de ingresos y es el cultivo que mas se produce por la zona que es apta. Esta producción la vende a un beneficio de café cercano del municipio. José decidió solicitar un segundo préstamo a la institución el cual es por 25,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar abono, foliar para fertilizar la finca y pago de trabajadores para cultivo de mas plantas de café y limpieza de la misma. Su propósito es invertir para que su finca produzca mejor cosecha y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En un futuro piensa comprar un terreno para cultivar mas café y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 60 years old, single, and has four children. He lives in a village that belongs to the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has spent his whole life working as a farmer with his family. For 15 years he has been growing coffee, his main source of income. It is the crop best-suited for the region so it is widely grown. He sells the beans to a coffee mill located near the municipality.

José has decided to ask for a second loan of 25,000 lempiras from the institution so he can buy manure and leaf fertilizer for the coffee plants, and also pay for workers to help plant the coffee and weed the fields. He expects the loan money will help him produce a better harvest and thus increase his income. In the future José would like to buy land so he can grow more coffee and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: Buy manure and leaf fertilizer, and hire workers

loans.name: Mama- Sani

texts.fr: Tailleur brodeur de profession, Mama - Sani sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des tissus afin de confectionner des habits pour revendre. Il se fait aider par 01 personne et espère à l'avenir construire une maison pour sa famille. Il a pour femme une revendeuse avec 02 enfants en charge. Avec une ancienneté de 08ans dans l'activité, Mama-- Sani est âgé de 35ans.
texts.en:
A tailor and embroiderer by trade, Mama-Sani is seeking a second loan to buy fabrics to make clothes to resell. He gets help from another person and, in the future, he hopes to be able to build a house for his family.

He's married to a reseller and they have two children in their care. He's 35 years old, and has been in this business for eight years.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make clothes to resell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, groceries, etc. Cristina has been in this business for 5 years. She also earns income from fishing, and buying and selling fruit.

Cristina has successfully repaid her previous loans, and she is now requesting this present loan to further build her business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell such as energy drinks, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lucia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items to sell like energy drinks, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 38 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Belen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, dozens of egg, noodles, shampoo and groceries.

Belen has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Belen aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, dozens of eggs, noodles, shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 41 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles and eggs.

Fe has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fishing.

Fe aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles and eggs

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Mère de famille (Mariée à un chauffeur avec 06 enfants scolarisés) madame Louise depuis 2004 revend des pagnes et des prêts à porter de façon ambulante. Vue la qualité de ses produits, elle dispose de nombreux clients. N'arrivant pas à répondre à leurs besoins par faute de moyens, elle fait un cinquiéme crédit à WAGES. Pour l'instant, Louise veut avoir sa propre boutique et s'assurer du bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Louise is married to a driver and the mother of a family. She has six children who all go to school. Since 2004, she's been reselling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and ready-to-wear clothing door-to-door.

Thanks to the quality of her products, she has numerous customers. Unable to meet their needs due to a lack of means, she's seeking a fifth loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES.

At this time, Louise wants to have her own shop and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 62 years old and is a widow with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, dozen of eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Rosela has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Rosela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, dozen of eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

Metelin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Emelina

Emelina has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Emelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Rowena earns more income from fattening pigs and selling fish.

She is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Leomaldy

texts.es: Mayor capital de trabajo, mayor liquidéz, mayores ventas e incremento de las utilidades en el negocio de Lemaldi, resume lo que generó su anterior credikiva.  Su negocio se ha fortalecido aun mas y así mismo los ingresos familiares , por eso ella dice a su financiadores de Kiva : " Estoy muy agradecida con este apoyo, he progresado y mi familia tambien, digan apoyándome por favor. " En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, para aprovechar una vez mas la temporada navideña y de año nuevo en la cual se incrementan sus ventas, pues tiene clientes fijos y ofrece plazos ajustados a sus requerimientos y esto es la razón por la cual sus compradores esperan resolver sus necesidades en el negocio de Leomaldy, con su credikiva comprará  ropa, calzado, adornos navideños y mercancías asociada a esta temporada de fiestas, para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa, dando satisfacción a su clientela.
texts.en:
An increased working capital, liquidity, higher sales, and increased profits in  Leomaldy’s business, sums up what she generated from her previous credikiva. Her business has been strengthened even more, and likewise her family’s income, so that’s why she tells her Kiva lenders: "I'm very grateful with this support, I have been able to move forward and my family too, keep supporting me please".

Currently she is requesting a credikiva to, once again, take advantage of the Christmas and new year season, which is when her sales increase.  She has regular customers and she tends to their tailored requirements, which is the reason that buyers are waiting to have their needs met in Leomaldy’s business.

With her credikiva she will purchase clothes, shoes, Christmas decorations and other products associated with this holiday season, to make her credikiva a successful investment, and give satisfaction to her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, Christmas decorations and other products to sell

loans.name: Sonita

texts.en:
Sonita is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and both her children are in school.

Sonita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Sonita has been fattening pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Felicidad works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Felicidad is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Angie

texts.es: Angie de 22 años de edad se dedica al comercio de variedades y ropa especialmente. Ella toma pedidos de su clientela, a quienes les vende a crédito y compra de contado y muchas veces a crédito, a mayoristas y distribuidores. Su meta actualmente es fortalecer su capital  de trabajo para incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades, pues su desafío mayor es  lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a las solicitudes de su clientela. Durante sus tres años de experiencia, Angie ha apoyado los gastos de su hogar y con su esposo, esperan cada vez más brindarle a su pequeña hija un mayor bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual resolverá su desafío de capacidad de compra en temporadas de mayor movimiento comercial. Este es su primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará ropa, ajustada a la temporada de navidad, y a  la celebración del año nuevo, también comprará variedades navideñas, para que sus clientes puedan entregar aguinaldos a bajo costo, adornar sus arboles de navidad, y sentirse como les gusta, en fiestas familiares con sus vecinos; con todo esta inversión Angie  logrará aumentar sus ingresos, lo que impactará positivamente su negocio.
texts.en:
Angie is 22 years old and works selling assorted items and especially clothes. She takes orders from her clients, to whom she sells on credit, and buys in cash and often on credit from wholesalers and distributors. Her current goal is to reinforce her working capital in order to increase her sales and profits, because her biggest challenge is to obtain a working capital that will allow her to satisfy her client’s wishes. 

During her three years of experience, Angie has contributed to the expenses of her household and with her husband, they are always hoping to offer their small daughter a better life. She is applying for a credikiva loan at this time, so that she can resolve her problem of not being able to buy sufficient stock in this season that offers the most commercial movement. 

This is her first credit with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With her loan she will buy clothes adapted the Christmas season and New Year’s celebrations, as well as various Christmas items so that her clients can use their Christmas pay on low-cost items, to decorate their Christmas trees, and feel comfortable and happy in their celebrations with family and neighbors. With this investment Angie will be able to increase her income, which will have a positive effect on her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes adapted to the holiday season and various Christmas items.

Flordeliza requested a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Yamwekré Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de quatre femmes actives travaille avec notre institution depuis novembre 2012 et jusque là elles ont toujours fait des remboursements correctes. Ces braves dames exerce diverses activités mais Mamounata responsable du groupe vend des céréales. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 5 scolarisés.Avec ce prêt, Mamounata va profiter de ses temps de récoltes au Burkina pour acheter des céréales à bon prix pour revendre. Avec le bénéfice de ses ventes, elle aidera son mari à solder la scolarité de ses enfants et le reste servira à la continuité de ses activités.
texts.en: This group, composed of four women, has been working with our microfinance institution since November 2012 and  always repaid its loans on time. These hard-working women are engaged in various business activities. Mamounata, the group leader, sells cereals. She is married and has seven children, five of whom attend school. With this loan, Mamounata will take advantage of the harvest time in Burkina Faso in order to buy cereals at a good price for resale. Thanks to her revenues, she will help her husband cover the school expenses for her children and use the rest to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.
